settings.name: access_token
settings.label: Access Token
settings.help:
This is an access token generated on the My Security page of your High Fidelity account.
Generate a token with the 'domains' scope and paste it here.
This is required to associate this domain-server with a domain in your account.

settings.name: id
settings.label: Domain ID
settings.help: This is your High Fidelity domain ID. If you do not want your domain to be registered in the High Fidelity metaverse you can leave this blank.

settings.name: automatic_networking
settings.label: Automatic Networking
settings.help:
This defines how other nodes in the High Fidelity metaverse will be able to reach your domain-server.
If you don't want to deal with any network settings, use full automatic networking.

options.label: Full: update both the IP address and port to reach my server
IP Only: update just my IP address, I will open the port manually
None: use the network information I have entered for this domain at data.highfidelity.io

settings.name: local_port
settings.label: Local UDP Port
settings.help:
This is the local port your domain-server binds to for UDP connections.
Depending on your router, this may need to be changed to run multiple full automatic networking domain-servers in the same network.

settings.name: http_username
settings.label: HTTP Username
settings.help: Username used for basic HTTP authentication.

settings.name: http_password
settings.label: HTTP Password
settings.help: Password used for basic HTTP authentication. Leave this blank if you do not want to change it.

settings.name: allowed_users
settings.label: Allowed Users
settings.help:
List the High Fidelity names for people you want to be able to connect to this domain.
An empty list means everyone.
You can always connect from the domain-server machine.

settings.name: persistent_scripts
settings.label: Persistent Scripts
settings.help: Add the URLs for scripts that you would like to ensure are always running in your domain.

settings.name: attenuation_per_doubling_in_distance
settings.label: Default Domain Attenuation
settings.help: Factor between 0 and 1.0 (0: No attenuation, 1.0: extreme attenuation)

settings.name: noise_muting_threshold
settings.label: Noise Muting Threshold
settings.help: Loudness value for noise background between 0 and 1.0 (0: mute everyone, 1.0: never mute)

settings.name: enable_filter
settings.help: positional audio stream uses lowpass filter

settings.name: zones
settings.label: Zones
settings.help: In this table you can define a set of zones in which you can specify various audio properties.

settings.name: attenuation_coefficients
settings.label: Attenuation Coefficients
settings.help: In this table you can set custom attenuation coefficients between audio zones

settings.name: reverb
settings.label: Reverb Settings
settings.help: In this table you can set reverb levels for audio zones.  For a medium-sized (e.g., 100 square meter) meeting room, try a decay time of around 1.5 seconds and a wet level of -10 db. For an airplane hangar or cathedral, try a decay time of 4 seconds and a wet level of -5 db.

settings.name: dynamic_jitter_buffer
settings.label: Dynamic Jitter Buffers
settings.help: dynamically buffer client audio based on perceived jitter in packet receipt timing

settings.name: static_desired_jitter_buffer_frames
settings.label: Static Desired Jitter Buffer Frames
settings.help: If dynamic jitter buffers is disabled, this determines the target number of frames maintained by the AudioMixer's jitter buffers

settings.name: max_frames_over_desired
settings.label: Max Frames Over Desired
settings.help: The highest number of frames an AudioMixer's ringbuffer can exceed the desired jitter buffer frames by

settings.name: use_stdev_for_desired_calc
settings.label: Use Stdev for Desired Jitter Frames Calc:
settings.help: use Philip's method (stdev of timegaps) to calculate desired jitter frames (otherwise Fred's max timegap method is used)

settings.name: window_starve_threshold
settings.label: Window Starve Threshold
settings.help: If this many starves occur in an N-second window (N is the number in the next field), then the desired jitter frames will be re-evaluated using Window A.

settings.name: window_seconds_for_desired_calc_on_too_many_starves
settings.label: Timegaps Window (A) Seconds:
settings.help: Window A contains a history of timegaps. Its max timegap is used to re-evaluate the desired jitter frames when too many starves occur within it.

settings.name: window_seconds_for_desired_reduction
settings.label: Timegaps Window (B) Seconds:
settings.help: Window B contains a history of timegaps. Its max timegap is used as a ceiling for the desired jitter frames value.

settings.name: repetition_with_fade
settings.label: Repetition with Fade:
settings.help: dropped frames and mixing during starves repeat the last frame, eventually fading to silence

settings.name: print_stream_stats
settings.label: Print Stream Stats:
settings.help: audio upstream and downstream stats of each agent printed to audio-mixer stdout

settings.name: persistFilename
settings.label: Entities Filename
settings.help: the path to the file entities are stored in. Make sure the path exists.

settings.name: persistInterval
settings.label: Save Check Interval
settings.help: Milliseconds between checks for saving the current state of entities.

settings.name: backups
settings.label: Backup Rules
settings.help: In this table you can define a set of rules for how frequently to backup copies of your entites content file.

columns.name: format
columns.label: Rule Format
columns.help: Format used to create the extension for the backup of your persisted entities. Use a format with %N to get rolling. Or use date formatting like %Y-%m-%d.%H:%M:%S.%z

columns.name: backupInterval
columns.label: Backup Interval in Seconds
columns.help: Interval between backup checks in seconds.

columns.name: maxBackupVersions
columns.label: Max Rolled Backup Versions
columns.help: If your backup extension format uses 'rolling', how many versions do you want us to keep?

settings.name: NoPersist
settings.help: Don't persist your entities to a file.

settings.name: NoBackup
settings.help: Don't regularly backup your persisted entities to a backup file.

settings.name: statusHost
settings.label: Status Hostname
settings.help: host name or IP address of the server for accessing the status page

settings.name: statusPort
settings.label: Status Port
settings.help: port of the server for accessing the status page

settings.name: verboseDebug
settings.help: lots of debugging

settings.name: debugReceiving
settings.help: extra debugging on receiving

settings.name: debugSending
settings.help: extra debugging on sending

settings.name: debugTimestampNow
settings.help: extra debugging for usecTimestampNow() function

settings.name: clockSkew
settings.label: Clock Skew
settings.help: Number of msecs to skew the server clock by to test clock skew
